name: Karl Bringmann
content: Homepage: Karl Bringmann (Max-Planck-Institut für Informatik) Department 1: Algorithms and Complexity max planck institut informatik Homepage Karl Bringmann Max-Planck-Institut fÃ¼r Informatik Department 1: Algorithms and Complexity Email: kbringmampi-inf.mpg.de Until end of 2025, I am a professor at Saarland University and affiliated to Max Planck Institute for Informatics. Starting 2026 I will join ETH Zurich as a full professor. I am interested in theoretical computer science, specifically in conditional lower bounds (e.g. based on the Strong Exponential Time Hypothesis) and algorithm design working mostly on optimization and computational geometry. Since recently I also explore realistic machine models. Job Openings In January 2026 I will join ETH Zurich, and thus I am looking for new postdocs. I am currently not offering internships or external Bachelor/Master theses. Moreover, due to a high volume of messages, I am currently unable to respond to internship requests or related inquiries. Thank you for your understanding. January 2016 - October 2019: PostDoc and Senior Researcher (since 2017) at Max Planck Institute for Informatics August 2015 - December 2015: Research Fellow at the Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing, Berkeley, participating in the program "Fine-Grained Complexity and Algorithm Design" September 2014 - August 2015: PostDoc at ETH Zurich, holding an ETH Zurich Postdoctoral Fellowship April 2011 - August 2014: Ph. D. student in Computer Science at Saarland University, Saarbrücken, Germany and Max Planck Institute for Informatics, under supervision of Kurt Mehlhorn Holding a Google European Doctoral Fellowship since 2012 Thesis won an EATCS Distinguished Dissertation Award C
